Job Title: Sr. Manager, Warehouse & Logistics

Location: North Carolina, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Sr. Manager, Warehouse & Logistics Grifols Shared Services, NA

 Senior Manager Warehouse and Logistics, NA 

Grifols has been a leader in the healthcare industry since 1909 by creating innovative products and services based on the values of ethics, quality and responsibility. Grifols' activities focus on fulfilling the needs of its patients as well as healthcare professionals working in therapeutics, pharmacy, diagnostics and blood banking. For more than 100 years, Grifols has developed, manufactured and marketed product designed to improve human health. Grifols manufactures plasma derived biopharmaceutical products of proven efficacy, quality and safety. For more information, please visit our website: http://www.grifols.com

Position Overview

The primary role of the Senior Manager Warehouse and Logistics North America is to efficiently and effectively leverage logistics excellence to include Grifols 3PL partners, Carrier Partners, Customer Service, International Trade and Compliance (ITCL) and Global Supply Chain / Logistics. This role serves as the key Warehouse and Logistics contact for both internal and external customers for shipping and warehousing. The Senior Manager Warehouse and Logistics North America helps drive customer loyalty and achievement of the company’s sales, revenue and EBIT objectives by delivering best in class fulfillment and logistics operations enhancing the customer experience, but also optimizing the use of resources and costs in the North American Supply Chain.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To The Following

Activities & Authority / Accountabilities

 Develop and execute programs to identify improvement opportunities, prioritize, and drive initiatives to obtain value including the harmonization of transportation between BU’s, packaging used for courier final mile shipments and warehousing operations  Implement and manage a common set of key performance metrics standardized by Global Supply Chain to accurately depict performance on inventory/order accuracy, cost, service and improvement initiatives across warehouse and logistic operations.  Harmonization of the Logistics Network supporting all Grifols North America entities.  Partner cross-functionally to understand customer wants and needs, and develop solutions to drive excellence in customer experience and logistics while delivering savings to Grifols overall spend  Lead coordination of regional MSA development between Grifols BU’s, Legal, Quality and Suppliers  Develop regional freight and warehouse budgets and set QBR’s with all Tier I Partners  Participate in determining transportation solutions for Inbound and Outbound Transportation while leveraging Grifols North American entities  Ensure vendor’s adherence to Grifols SOPs and Quality Standards  Support all Policies and Strategies of Global Supply Chain and the Regional Supply Chain Partners 


Identify and execute joint value creation opportunities in the supply chain with key internal customers

Activities & Authority / Accountabilities

 Capture and commercialize joint value creation with key internal customers relating to Warehouse and Logistics.  Cultivate a culture of measurement and data-driven decision making 


Establish the right organization structure and lead the development of your people

Activities & Authority / Accountabilities

 Identifying, training and developing leaders within the company and setting them on a path for management  Drive an aligned, customer-focused culture through clear performance targets and regular one-on-ones.  Promote a clear engagement strategy through meetings and communications aligned to key business objectives.  Implement talent development and staffing and succession routines. 


Make sure the corporate requirements for safety, health and environment factors are flawless

Activities & Authority / Accountabilities

 Focus on safety — with clear focus and training in place. 


 Skills/Qualifications/Education Requirements:  (To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions)

Bachelor’s in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, engineering or a related field. A degree in a related field is strongly preferred

 Experience  : This role requires 5+ years’ experience in logistics management and 5 or more years’ prior supervisory/managerial experience. Past overall supply chain management experience over different SC functions will be an asset. Multi-site and multi-mode logistics and warehouse management is required.

 Focuses relentlessly on customers Drives for results Challenges the status quo Works well under pressure Communication skills, including verbal, written and presentation Interpersonal skills, including relationship-building and persuasion Analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills Conflict management skills Ability to coach and advise team members and work with remote teams Ability to provide actionable and well-supported recommendations Proficiency in relevant software, such as Microsoft Office, SAP ERP, CRM Proficiency in Lean, Six Sigma or continuous improvement methodologies is a plus


Work is performed in an office environment with exposure to electrical office equipment. Frequently sits for 6-8 hours per day. Frequent hand movement of both hands with the ability to make fast, simple movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists. Occasionally walks. Occasionally bends and twists neck. Light to moderate lifting and carrying objects with a maximum lift of 25lbs. Frequently drives to site locations with occasional travel within the United States. Able to communicate complex information and ideas so others will understand; with the ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Works independently with little guidance or reliance on oral or written instructions and plans work schedules to meet goals. Frequently interacts with others, relates sensitive information to diverse groups. Must work with diverse groups to obtain consensus on issues. Ability to apply abstract principles to solve complex conceptual issues.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
